skill.name: project-planner
skill.description: Comprehensive project planning and documentation generator for software projects. Creates structured requirements documents, system design documents, and task breakdown plans with implementation tracking. Use when starting a new project, defining specifications, creating technical designs, or breaking down complex systems into implementable tasks. Supports user story format, acceptance criteria, component design, API specifications, and hierarchical task decomposition with requirement traceability.
skill.summary: Comprehensive project planning and documentation generator for software projects. Creates structured...
skill.author: Dwsy

security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate documentation generation skill. The Python scripts only read and write files to user-specified paths for generating markdown templates. No network calls, no credential access, no code execution beyond template generation.

content.value_statement: Planning software projects without clear documentation leads to missed requirements and unclear implementation paths. This skill creates structured requirements documents, technical designs, and task breakdowns with traceability between all artifacts.
actual_capabilities: Generate requirements documents with user stories and testable acceptance criteria
Create system design documents with component maps and data flow diagrams
Build implementation plans with hierarchical task breakdowns and dependencies
Validate existing documents for completeness and consistency
Apply domain-specific templates for web apps, APIs, microservices, and more
Trace requirements through design elements to implementation tasks
limitations: Generated documents are templates that require user input and customization
Requires Python runtime for script-based document generation
Does not execute code or implement features directly

use_cases.title: Start new software projects
use_cases.description: Generate complete documentation foundations for new software projects before writing any code

use_cases.title: Create technical specifications
use_cases.description: Produce detailed architecture documents and implementation plans for team hand-offs

use_cases.title: Define project requirements
use_cases.description: Create structured user stories with acceptance criteria that developers can implement

prompt_templates.title: New project
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the Project Planner skill to generate requirements, design, and implementation plan documents for a new web application called [Project Name]. Include features: [list features]. Components: [list components].

prompt_templates.title: Add feature
prompt_templates.prompt: Add a new requirement to my requirements.md document. User story format: As a [role], I want [feature], so that [benefit]. Include 4 testable acceptance criteria using SHALL statements.

prompt_templates.title: Design architecture
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a design document for [system description]. Include: component map with responsibilities, data flow diagrams for key processes, API interface contracts, and deployment configuration.

prompt_templates.title: Break down tasks
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an implementation plan with phases: Infrastructure, Data Layer, Business Logic, API, Frontend, Testing, Deployment. Include task dependencies and trace each task to requirements.

output_examples.input: Generate project planning documents for a task management application
output: Requirements Document created with 5 user stories and acceptance criteria
Design Document created with 6 components and data flow specifications
Implementation Plan created with 7 phases and 21 tasks
Documents saved to: requirements.md, design.md, tasks.md

best_practices: Define requirements with measurable acceptance criteria using SHALL statements
Map every task back to a requirement ID for full traceability
Specify component responsibilities and interfaces before implementation
anti_patterns: Skipping architectural planning and jumping directly to code
Using vague acceptance criteria like user-friendly or fast without metrics
Creating monolithic components without clear boundaries or interfaces

faq.question: Which project types are supported?
faq.answer: Web applications, CLI tools, API services, microservices, data pipelines, and generic projects.

faq.question: How many documents does this skill generate?
faq.answer: Three core documents: requirements.md, design.md, and tasks.md for implementation tracking.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with CI/CD pipelines?
faq.answer: Yes. Use the validate_documents.py script to check document completeness in automated workflows.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. All processing is local. Scripts read and write only to paths you specify. No data is sent externally.

faq.question: Why are generated documents just templates?
faq.answer: Templates provide structure. You must fill in project-specific details. This ensures documentation matches your actual requirements.

faq.question: How does this compare to other planning tools?
faq.answer: This skill focuses on AI-assisted documentation generation with templates optimized for AI implementation. It creates machine-readable and human-readable markdown files.
